snippet: Mansour J. Arbabsiar, charged in a plot to kill Saudi Arabia’s ambassador to the United States, could not have rationally waived his rights, as he was suffering from bipolar disorder, two experts say.
abstract: Lawyers for Mansour J Arbabsiar, Iranian-American man charged in a 2011 plot to kill Saudi Arabia’s ambassador to the United States, ask Judge John F Keenan of Federal District Court in Manhattan to order the suppression at trial of statements their client made during interrogation; claim is that Arbabsiar was suffering from bipolar disorder when he allegedly confessed to his role in the plot.
lead_paragraph: Mansour J. Arbabsiar, charged in a plot to kill Saudi Arabia’s ambassador to the United States, could not have rationally waived his rights, as he was suffering from bipolar disorder, two experts say.

headline.seo: Mansour Arbabsiar’s Lawyers Cite Mental Illness in Challenge to Charges
headline.main: Mental Illness Cited in Challenge to Terror Case
headline.print_headline: Illness Cited In Challenge In Terror Case
